page.title: 17ISLAND OF MOUSA-SANDWICK
page.content: To the east of Sandwick lies the island of Mousa which is about 3miles long and 1/2mile wide. We went on the "Solan" from Sandsayre to visit the uninhabited island. The boat could carry 12 passengers and took 20 minutes for the crossing. We saw seals, porpoises and lots of birds during the crossing. When we reached Mousa we walked along the west shore till we reached the broch which is very famous. It was built about the end of the last century BC-first century AD. It is 50Ft(15m) in diameter and 43.5 ft (13.3m) high. It is a tower like structure built using the flagstonesfrom the shore nearby. We climbed up the steps between the double wall structure to the top of the broch.
